com.telek.telekmath.advanced.random

Class TRandom

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telek.telekmath.advanced.random.TRandom

  • public class TRandom
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int LCG_DEFAULT_ITERATION_COUNT
      Defines how many times the linear-congruential generation algorithm will be iterated in each method

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int[] getStepsForCollatzConjecture(int seed)
      Returns the generated steps using the number seed, if number is even then do x/2, if odd then do 3x+1
      static int randomNumberLCG(int seed, int c)
      Returns a random number in range [0, 2^31-1] using linear-congruential generation algorithm.
      static int randomNumberLCG(int seed, int c, int iterationCount)
      Returns a random number in range [0, 2^31-1] using linear-congruential generation algorithm.
      static int randomNumberLCG(int a, int seed, int c, int M)
      Returns a random number in range [0, M] using linear-congruential generation algorithm.
      static int randomNumberLCG(int a, int seed, int c, int M, int iterationCount)
      Returns a random number in range [0, M] using linear-congruential generation algorithm.

    • Field Detail

      • LCG_DEFAULT_ITERATION_COUNT

        public static int LCG_DEFAULT_ITERATION_COUNT
        Defines how many times the linear-congruential generation algorithm will be iterated in each method

    • Method Detail

      • randomNumberLCG

        public static int randomNumberLCG(int a,
                                  int seed,
                                  int c,
                                  int M,
                                  int iterationCount)
        Returns a random number in range [0, M] using linear-congruential generation algorithm. M value should be a prime for good generations
        Parameters:
        a - a constant number to multiply
        seed - your seed
        c - constant number to add
        M - a constant number take the modulus, this value should be a prime for good results
        iterationCount - how many times this process will be applied
        Returns:
        a random number in range [0,M]

      • randomNumberLCG

        public static int randomNumberLCG(int a,
                                  int seed,
                                  int c,
                                  int M)
        Returns a random number in range [0, M] using linear-congruential generation algorithm. Uses LCG_DEFAULT_ITERATION_COUNT as iterationCount
        Parameters:
        a - a constant number to multiply
        seed - your seed
        c - constant number to add
        M - a constant number take the modulus, this value should be a prime for good results
        Returns:
        a random number in range [0,M]

      • randomNumberLCG

        public static int randomNumberLCG(int seed,
                                  int c,
                                  int iterationCount)
        Returns a random number in range [0, 2^31-1] using linear-congruential generation algorithm. Uses Park and Miller numbers. a = 16807, M = 2^31-1 (mersenne prime).
        Parameters:
        seed - your seed
        c - constant number to add
        iterationCount - how many times this process will be applied
        Returns:
        a random number in range [0, 2^31-1]

      • randomNumberLCG

        public static int randomNumberLCG(int seed,
                                  int c)
        Returns a random number in range [0, 2^31-1] using linear-congruential generation algorithm. Uses Park and Miller numbers. a = 16807, M = 2^31-1 (mersenne prime). Also uses LCG_DEFAULT_ITERATION_COUNT as iterationCount
        Parameters:
        seed - your seed
        c - constant number to add
        Returns:
        a random number in range [0, 2^31-1]

      • getStepsForCollatzConjecture

        public static int[] getStepsForCollatzConjecture(int seed)
        Returns the generated steps using the number seed, if number is even then do x/2, if odd then do 3x+1
        Parameters:
        seed - any number to start
        Returns:
        the steps as a int array
